name: Section 16 of RA 7160 provides that “Every local government unit shall exercise the powers
expressly granted, those necessarily implied therefrom, as well as powers necessary,
appropriate, or incidental for its efficient and effective governance, and those which are
essential to the promotion of the general welfare. Within their respective territorial
jurisdictions, local government units shall ensure and support, among other things, the
preservation and enrichment of culture, promote health and safety, enhance the right of the
people to a balance ecology, encourage and support the development of appropriate and
self-reliant scientific and technological capabilities, improve public morals, enhance
economic prosperity and social justice, promote full employment among their residents,
maintain peace and order, and preserve the comfort and convenience of their inhabitants.”
. Vision:
 Good governance and responsible citizenship
o driven by a shared development direction crafted, implemented and continually
improved in an inclusive manner;
o sustained by a citizenry that asserts and accepts their roles and responsibilities in
nation-building;
 People-centered development
o anchored on quality and accessible services in health, education and other social
services, especially for the marginalized and the vulnerable;
o that enables the private sector to generate the best value from local talents,
technology and resources, and provide gainful jobs and entrepreneurial
opportunities for the Nagueño;
 Abiding faith that expresses itself in social solidarity and a culture of excellence
o flourishing in a city that is peaceful, safe and in accord with nature; where cultural
values are nurtured and religious diversity respected; and where technology
enables the Nagueño to be part of a global community of people and nations.

 Soil sample
1. Collect soil samples and air-dry them in a clean and ventilated room for 3 days. If you have any query regarding the collection of samples, you approach the AT assigned to your barangay.
2. Label the soil samples, indicating your name, farm location, the crops to be planted and the size of the area for planting.
3. Mix the soil samples collected and submit them to the AT for analysis.
4. The AT brings the samples to the CAgO; Samples are analyzed; and the results are released.
 Dry and Clean Corn
1. The farmer client will bring the dry and clean corn at the City Nursery Corn Mill
2. The personnel-in- charge will receive and record the corn and turn it over to the corn mill operator for milling
3. The payment will be collected by the assigned collector or the personnel- in-charge, to be remitted to the City Treasurer’s Office
4. Farmer clients may assist in bagging the milled corn

3. After milling, the corn will be weighed as the basis for computation of payment

5. Farmer clients may assist in bagging the rice produced.

How to file a complaint?

FORMAL COMPLAINT A written complaint subscribed and sworn to by the complainant shall be submitted and duly received by the Office of the Mayor. No anonymous complaint shall be entertained unless there is obvious truth or merit to the allegations therein. The complaint should be written in a clear, simple and concise language and in a systematic manner so as to apprise the civil servant concerned of the nature and cause of the accusation against him and to enable him/her to intelligently prepare his/her defense or answer. The complaint shall contain the following: a) Full name and address of the complaint b) Full name and address of the person complained of as well as his/her position and office of employment c) A narration of the relevant and material facts which shows the acts or omissions allegedly committed by the civil servant d) Certified true copies of documentary evidence and affidavits of his witness, if any, and e) Certification or statement of non-forum shopping
